properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued February 11 at 3:02PM CST until February 12 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock AR
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Little Rock has expanded the

* Flash Flood Watch to include a portion of southwest Arkansas,
including the following areas, Clark, Hot Spring, and Pike.

* Through Wednesday afternoon

* Periods of showers and thunderstorms will continue over
southern and southeast Arkansas through Wednesday. Heavy rain
has fallen over the watch area in the last 24-36 hours.
Additional heavy rainfall is likely, with one to three inch
amounts possible, and localized heavier amounts exceeding
three inches. With an already saturated ground, flash flooding
may occur.

* Since vegetation is dormant, and not consuming much ground
water, runoff from heavy rain will be increased. This elevates
the concern for flash flooding. Also, rapid rises may occur on
creeks, small streams, and flashy rivers.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON
